message: I'm excited to offer you this amazing product for a special price. I think you'll really love it!
Thanks for the offer, Alice, but that price is a little too high for me.  I'm interested in the product, but I'd be willing to pay around $6,000 for it.
I understand you're looking for a good deal, Bob, but I'm not willing to go as low as $6,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, though. I can offer it to you for $12,000. What do you think?
I appreciate you meeting me halfway, Alice.  While $12,000 is closer to what I had in mind, it's still a bit out of my budget. How about we settle at $8,000? That feels like a fair compromise to me.

I'm glad we're close, Bob, but I really need to get at least $12,000 for this product. I'm willing to make one more compromise, so I'll offer it to you for $11,000. That's the lowest I can go, but I think it's still a great deal for you.
Alice, I understand this is your bottom line, but I can't justify going above $8,000.  If you're unable to meet that price, I appreciate your time but I may need to explore other options.

I understand you're not willing to go above $8,000, Bob, but I'm not willing to sell it to you for that price. I'll make one final offer: I'll sell it to you for $9,500. That's the closest I can get to meeting your budget while still getting a fair price for the product.
Alice, I appreciate you coming down, but I'm afraid $8,000 is really the most I can justify spending. If you can do $8,000, the deal is yours. Otherwise, I wish you all the best.

I've made one concession after another, Bob, and I'm starting to think we're getting nowhere. I'm willing to make one last stand: I'll sell it to you for $9,000, but that's as low as I can go. If you're not willing to meet me at that price, I'm afraid I'll have to consider other options.
